snippet: Senior officials showed lawmakers a video of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl from January that raised alarms about his health and spurred action, but the meeting failed to quell anger on Capitol Hill.
abstract: White House officials fail to quell rising anger and frustration in both parties on Capitol Hill after a senators-only classified briefing about Pres Obama’s decision to free five Taliban prisoners in return for the release of Sgt Bowe Bergdahl, who military officials say walked off his base in 2009.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JEREMY W. PETERS
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Constanta, Romania, and Jonathan Weisman and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Senior officials showed lawmakers a video of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl from January that raised alarms about his health and spurred action, but the meeting failed to quell anger on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: Senators Show Frustration After Briefing on Ex-P.O.W.
headline.print_headline: Senators Show Frustration After Briefing on Ex-P.O.W.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
